front.title: An Architecture for Open Human Friendly Naming of Internet Resource Addresses ('URLs')

abstract.t: As use of the Internet has become widespread, it's become increasinglyclear that the URL -- the mechanism most users employ to designateresources -- is inherently confusing to non-technical users, and to agreat extent, is unusable by them. For that reason, an easier namingscheme that employs human-friendly names ('HFNs') is desirable andnecessary.
